channel.title: TFS Build API by Example #1: Queue a build.
channel.description: As we all know by now - the build system in TFS2008 was substantially improved.  Along with the many improvements came an official API for talking to the build system.  This is the same API that the Team Foundation...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Jeff Snyder+00:00
item.description:
Hi Martin,
Great example! Would you happen to know how to replace the "Queue New Build" popup menu item when you right-click on a build definition from the Team Explorer window. I have written a custom add-in form, and I want to use my own form when the user clicks to queue a new build.
Thanks in advance for any advice you might have.
Jeff Snyder
item.dc:creator: Jeff Snyder

item.title: Comment by Jason Camp+00:00
item.description: I would like to know the same thing as Jeff.
item.dc:creator: Jason Camp

item.title: Comment by Martin Woodward+00:00
item.description:
*Replacing* the form would be difficult. It should be possible to contribute extensions to the Team Explorer context menu in Visual Studio but I would have to dig around to get that to work.
What I have seen people do in the past when they have some complex build queuing requirements is to disable build queuing permissions for nearly everyone and then have a web form that people have to go to when queuing a build.
Can I ask why the built in dialog doesn't work for you?
M.
item.dc:creator: Martin Woodward

item.title: Comment by Janaka Goonasekera+00:00
item.description:
Hi Martin,
I am creating a custom application to queue builds.
If my build config file includes running tests, is there a way to programatically get back the test results, code coverage results and the code analysis results?
Thanks!
item.dc:creator: Janaka Goonasekera
